20110117030656.000|20110117030658.000|TR0|tell you about right now. Former dictator 
20110117030658.000|20110117030701.000|TR0|Jean-Claude "Baby Doc" Duvalier has 
20110117030701.000|20110117030703.000|TR0|returned to the country after 25 years in 
20110117030703.000|20110117030706.000|TR0|exile.  Now a big crowd greeted him at the 
20110117030706.000|20110117030709.000|TR0|airport, but it's not immediately clear 
20110117030709.000|20110117030711.000|TR0|why he returned.  The Duvalier Family 
20110117030711.000|20110117030714.000|TR0|ruled Haiti with an iron fist for three 
20110117030714.000|20110117030716.000|TR0|decades, and Baby Doc, as he is called, 
20110117030716.000|20110117030719.000|TR0|led Haiti for 15 years before a revolt 
20110117030719.000|20110117030721.000|TR0|forced him to flee France.  He returns to 
20110117030721.000|20110117030724.000|TR0|a country grappling with a devastating 
20110117030724.000|20110117030726.000|TR0|earthquake, cholera and epidemic there and 
20110117030726.000|20110117030729.000|TR0|contested presidential elections.

20110117030759.000|20110117030802.000|TR0|telephone):  Well, we ended up, all of us, 
20110117030802.000|20110117030804.000|TR0|were surprised, and the country almost 
20110117030804.000|20110117030807.000|TR0|couldn't believe the news.  The Air France 
20110117030807.000|20110117030810.000|TR0|flight arrived from Paris late this 
20110117030810.000|20110117030812.000|TR0|afternoon, and on it was Jean-Claude 
20110117030812.000|20110117030815.000|TR0|Duvalier and his long-time partner 
20110117030815.000|20110117030817.000|TR0|Veronique West, and they were caught up in

20110117031125.000|20110117031128.000|TR0|WATSON:  It's really unclear, you know, 
20110117031128.000|20110117031130.000|TR0|Don.  There is a leadership vacuum here of

20110117033254.000|20110117033257.000|TR0|LEMON:  Identity theft is always a 
20110117033257.000|20110117033259.000|TR0|concern, and right now around the first of 
20110117033259.000|20110117033302.000|TR0|the year is an especially dangerous time.  
20110117033302.000|20110117033304.000|TR0|Our Christine Romans is here to tell us 
20110117033304.000|20110117033307.000|TR0|why in tonight's edition of "Mastering 
20110117033307.000|20110117033309.000|TR0|Your Money" -- Christine?
20110117033309.000|20110117033312.000|TR0|
20110117033312.000|20110117033315.000|TR0|CHRISTINE ROMANS, CNN BUSINESS 
20110117033315.000|20110117033317.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  Don, that's absolutely 
20110117033317.000|20110117033320.000|TR0|right.  January is when employers send out 
20110117033320.000|20110117033322.000|TR0|all their year-end tax documents including 
20110117033322.000|20110117033325.000|TR0|our W-2s and brokerage statements.  These, 
20110117033325.000|20110117033327.000|TR0|of course, contain personal and precious 
20110117033327.000|20110117033330.000|TR0|information and often sit unguarded in our 
20110117033330.000|20110117033332.000|TR0|mailboxes. So here's what you can do.  
20110117033332.000|20110117033335.000|TR0|Monitor your mail daily.  The worst thing 
20110117033335.000|20110117033337.000|TR0|you can do, according to our friends at 
20110117033337.000|20110117033340.000|TR0|Credit.com, is let your important 
20110117033340.000|20110117033342.000|TR0|documents sit in an unlocked mailbox 
20110117033342.000|20110117033345.000|TR0|overnight.  If you're planning on going 
20110117033345.000|20110117033348.000|TR0|away, have your mail held at a post office 
20110117033348.000|20110117033350.000|TR0|or have ask a trusted neighbor to retrieve 
20110117033350.000|20110117033353.000|TR0|your mail on a regular basis.
20110117033353.000|20110117033355.000|TR0|
20110117033355.000|20110117033358.000|TR0|Write down every piece of information-rich 
20110117033358.000|20110117033400.000|TR0|mail you anticipate receiving in January.  
20110117033400.000|20110117033403.000|TR0|Mark it off when it arrives.  This will 
20110117033403.000|20110117033405.000|TR0|help you keep track of which documents you 
20110117033405.000|20110117033408.000|TR0|receive and which documents never reach 
20110117033408.000|20110117033410.000|TR0|you.  Whenever possible, you can choose 
20110117033410.000|20110117033413.000|TR0|electronic delivery.  Having as many 
20110117033413.000|20110117033416.000|TR0|official year-end documents sent directly 
20110117033416.000|20110117033418.000|TR0|to your e-mail inbox that can also help 
20110117033418.000|20110117033421.000|TR0|prevent mailbox theft.
20110117033421.000|20110117033423.000|TR0|
20110117033423.000|20110117033426.000|TR0|And finally, check your credit reports.  
20110117033426.000|20110117033428.000|TR0|Please, do it.  Do it right now.  By March 
20110117033428.000|20110117033431.000|TR0|and February -- by February and March, 
20110117033431.000|20110117033433.000|TR0|you'll want to get out your free credit 
20110117033433.000|20110117033436.000|TR0|report so you can see if a thief opened up 
20110117033436.000|20110117033438.000|TR0|any new accounts in your name.
20110117033438.000|20110117033441.000|TR0|
20110117033441.000|20110117033444.000|TR0|As we always remind our viewers, Don, the 
20110117033444.000|20110117033446.000|TR0|only place to get your government-mandated 
20110117033446.000|20110117033449.000|TR0|free yearly credit report is
